Macros | Functions
MRAM Functionality
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides helper functions for accessing and programming MRAM (Magnetic Random Access Memory) on Apollo5 devices. It supports memory programming, filling operations, address validation, and non-volatile memory management for persistent data storage.

Key Features

  1. MRAM Programming: Secure programming of MRAM memory regions.
  2. ROM Access: Helper functions for ROM-based operations.
  3. Memory Filling: Efficient memory fill operations with patterns.
  4. Security: Secure memory programming with key validation.
  5. Alignment: Proper memory alignment and boundary checking.

Functionality

  • Program MRAM memory regions with data
  • Fill memory regions with specific patterns
  • Handle memory alignment and boundary validation
  • Support secure memory programming operations
  • Provide ROM-based helper functions

Usage

  1. Program MRAM using am_hal_mram_main_words_program()
  2. Fill memory regions with am_hal_mram_main_fill()
  3. Initialize memory regions as needed
  4. Handle memory programming errors
  5. Validate memory addresses and alignment

Configuration

  • Programming Keys: Configure secure programming keys
  • Memory Alignment: Ensure proper word alignment
  • Address Validation: Validate memory addresses and boundaries
  • Security: Set up secure memory programming parameters

#define AM_HAL_MRAM_PROGRAM   1
 
#define AM_HAL_INFO0_SIZE_BYTES   (2 * 1024)

#define AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL8   ( AM_HAL_MRAM_ERROR + 0x08 )
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL9   ( AM_HAL_MRAM_ERROR + 0x09 )

MRAM Program keys.

#define AM_HAL_MRAM_PROGRAM_KEY   0x12344321
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_INFO_KEY   0xD894E09E
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_MRAM_REGION   0x01
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_ITCM_REGION   0x02
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_DTCM_REGION   0x04
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_SSRAM_REGION   0x08
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_SRAM_REGION   0x10
 

Some helpful SRAM values and macros.

#define AM_HAL_MRAM_SRAM_ADDR   SSRAM_BASEADDR
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_SRAM_SIZE   SSRAM_MAX_SIZE
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_SRAM_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR   (AM_HAL_MRAM_SRAM_ADDR + AM_HAL_MRAM_SRAM_SIZE - 1)
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_DTCM_START   DTCM_BASEADDR
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_DTCM_SIZE   DTCM_MAX_SIZE
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_DTCM_END   (AM_HAL_MRAM_SRAM_ADDR + AM_HAL_MRAM_DTCM_SIZE - 1)
 

Some helpful MRAM values and macros.

#define AM_HAL_MRAM_ADDR   MRAM_BASEADDR
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_INSTANCE_SIZE   ( 2 * 1024 * 1024 )
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_NUM_INSTANCES   2
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_TOTAL_SIZE   ( AM_HAL_MRAM_INSTANCE_SIZE * AM_HAL_MRAM_NUM_INSTANCES )
 
#define AM_HAL_MRAM_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR   ( AM_HAL_MRAM_ADDR + AM_HAL_MRAM_TOTAL_SIZE - 1 )

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_mram_ds_init()

uint32_t am_hal_mram_ds_init ( void )

Initialize MRAM for DeepSleep.

This function implements a workaround required for Apollo4 B0 parts in order to fix the MRAM DeepSleep config params.

Returns
0 for success, non-zero for failure.

◆ am_hal_mram_main_fill()

uint32_t am_hal_mram_main_fill ( uint32_t ui32ProgramKey,
uint32_t ui32Value,
uint32_t * pui32Dst,
uint32_t ui32NumWords )

This Fills up to N words of the Main MRAM.

Parameters
ui32ProgramKey- The programming key, AM_HAL_MRAM_PROGRAM_KEY.
ui32Value- 32-bit data value to fill into the MRAM
pui32Dst- Pointer to the 4 words (16 byte) aligned MRAM location where programming of the MRAM is to begin.
ui32NumWords- The number of words to be programmed. This MUST be a multiple of 4 (16 byte multiple)

This function will fill multiple 16 byte tuples in main MRAM with specified pattern.

Note
THIS FUNCTION ONLY OPERATES ON 16 BYTE BLOCKS OF MAIN MRAM. The pDst MUST be 4 words (16 byte) aligned, and ui32NumWords MUST be multiple of 4.
Returns
0 for success, non-zero for failure. Return codes indicate: AM_HAL_MRAM_SUCCESS Operation was successful. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_KEY ui32InfoKey is invalid. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_START_MRAM_ADDR ui32Offset is invalid. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_END_MRAM_ADDR Destination addressing range would be exceeded. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_SRC_START_ADDR pui32Src is invalid. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_SRC_END_ADDR Source addressing range would be exceeded. AM_HAL_MRAM_HW_FAIL Hardware error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL7 Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL8 Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL9 Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_PWR_OFF Memory is not powered. AM_HAL_MRAM_WRITE_PROT NVRAM is write protected. AM_HAL_MRAM_READ_PROT NVRAM is read protected. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNALD Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_ADDR_ALIGNMENT puiDst not properly aligned for requested operation

◆ am_hal_mram_main_program()

uint32_t am_hal_mram_main_program ( uint32_t ui32ProgramKey,
uint32_t * pui32Src,
uint32_t * pui32Dst,
uint32_t ui32NumWords )

This programs up to N words of the Main MRAM.

Parameters
ui32ProgramKey- The programming key, AM_HAL_MRAM_PROGRAM_KEY.
pui32Src- Pointer to word aligned array of data to program into the MRAM.
pui32Dst- Pointer to the 4 words (16 byte) aligned MRAM location where programming of the MRAM is to begin.
ui32NumWords- The number of words to be programmed. This MUST be a multiple of 4 (16 byte multiple)

This function will program multiple 4 words (16 byte) tuples in main MRAM.

Note
THIS FUNCTION ONLY OPERATES ON 16 BYTE BLOCKS OF MAIN MRAM. The pDst MUST be 4 words (16 byte) aligned, and ui32NumWords MUST be multiple of 4.
Returns
0 for success, non-zero for failure. Return codes indicate: AM_HAL_MRAM_SUCCESS Operation was successful. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_KEY ui32InfoKey is invalid. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_START_MRAM_ADDR ui32Offset is invalid. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_END_MRAM_ADDR Destination addressing range would be exceeded. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_SRC_START_ADDR pui32Src is invalid. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_SRC_END_ADDR Source addressing range would be exceeded. AM_HAL_MRAM_HW_FAIL Hardware error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL7 Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL8 Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL9 Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_PWR_OFF Memory is not powered. AM_HAL_MRAM_WRITE_PROT NVRAM is write protected. AM_HAL_MRAM_READ_PROT NVRAM is read protected. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNALD Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_ADDR_ALIGNMENT puiDst not properly aligned for requested operation

◆ am_hal_mram_main_words_program()

uint32_t am_hal_mram_main_words_program ( uint32_t ui32ProgramKey,
uint32_t * pui32Src,
uint32_t * pui32Dst,
uint32_t ui32NumWords )

This programs up to N words of the Main MRAM.

Parameters
ui32ProgramKey- The programming key, AM_HAL_MRAM_PROGRAM_KEY.
pui32Src- Pointer to word aligned array of data to program into the MRAM.
pui32Dst- Pointer to the words (4 byte) aligned MRAM location where programming of the MRAM is to begin.
ui32NumWords- The number of words to be programmed.

This function will program multiple words (4 byte) tuples in main MRAM.

Note
This function is provided only for convenience. It is most efficient to operate on MRAM in groups of 4 words (16 byte) aligned multiples. Doing word access is programming inefficient and should be avoided.
Returns
0 for success, non-zero for failure. Return codes indicate: AM_HAL_MRAM_SUCCESS Operation was successful. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_KEY ui32InfoKey is invalid. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_START_MRAM_ADDR ui32Offset is invalid. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_END_MRAM_ADDR Destination addressing range would be exceeded. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_SRC_START_ADDR pui32Src is invalid. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_SRC_END_ADDR Source addressing range would be exceeded. AM_HAL_MRAM_HW_FAIL Hardware error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL7 Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL8 Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNAL9 Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_PWR_OFF Memory is not powered. AM_HAL_MRAM_WRITE_PROT NVRAM is write protected. AM_HAL_MRAM_READ_PROT NVRAM is read protected. AM_HAL_MRAM_INTERNALD Internal error. AM_HAL_MRAM_INVLD_ADDR_ALIGNMENT puiDst not properly aligned for requested operation
